featured.text: Despite their great 28 , however, most domesticated apples can be traced back to a common ancestor, the wild apple of Central Asia, Malus sieversii.

definition.zh_def: 西伯利亞蘋果樹，一種原產於中亞的野生蘋果樹，學名為Malus sieversii。
definition.en_def: Malus sieversii, a wild apple species native to Central Asia, considered a progenitor of the domesticated apple.
definition.example: Malus sieversii is important for apple breeding programs due to its genetic diversity.
